Meet Our New Principal Mrs. Angie Spears

Mrs. Spears went to Grand Valley State University to become a teacher. She received her Masters in Educational Leadership at Western Michigan University. She has been in education since 1995. (25 years – with a few years off while she had her daughters). Mrs. Spears taught 6th grade and 4th grade at Excel Charter Academy, then was the Assistant Principal/Dean for the past thirteen years.

Mrs. Spears chose to come to Knapp because she’s heard about the amazing community that exists here. Staff care deeply about students and families and it shows. She also loves the diversity of the community. As hard as things have been this past year, Mrs. Spears believes that we become stronger through adversity. She is excited to see how we reshape education as we learn new strategies and ways of teaching students. She’s seeing our staff come up with amazingly creative ways to teach online and in person with all of the restrictions and realities that we have in the midst of a pandemic. This is a crucial time, and we are doing a new thing.

Today is Science Friday. Knapp has a fun experiment for you to do at home. Email a picture of your project to 6.akozminski@nhaschools.com so we can share your fun science experiment.

The Rubber Egg
1. Place an egg into a tall drinking glass.
2. Pour vinegar into the glass until it is completely covered.
3. Put the glass to the side so nobody drinks it or spills it.
4. Let the egg soak overnight. Make some observations! You should notice a lot of foam and bubbles. When it seems to have slowed, move on to the next step.
5. Rinse the vinegar and foam out with water and then cover the egg again with vinegar.
6. Wait for 6 days. At the end of this time, rinse off the egg and pick it up.

You should notice it feels slightly different than when you started… most noticeably it is missing the shell and has a weird rubbery feel to it. Shake it. Gently squeeze it.

Test out your new creation in the sink by dropping it from a few inches and then some more.

You now have a cool creation that can astound your family.

post_text: Yesterday at Knapp, we started a new school-wide acknowledgement/ticket system as part of our PBIS (Positive Behavior Interventions & Supports) initiative. Students can earn tickets from any adult in the building by following the school-wide expectations as outlined in our Behavior Matrix. Each hall has their own reward system in place as far as what students do with their tickets and what they can buy/win with them. Knapp students are so excited about this new system, and we can’t wait to see how this helps our students to make great choices and be rewarded for their awesome behavior. Parents can give out tickets too - feel free to ask for a few from our wonderful office ladies if you are going to be volunteering in the building!
